ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Performs a sentiment analysis of textual contents in R. This implementation utilizes various existing dictionaries, such as Harvard IV, or finance-specific dictionaries. Furthermore, it can also create customized dictionaries. The latter uses LASSO regularization as a statistical approach to select relevant terms based on an exogenous response variable.

Performs a sentiment analysis of textual contents in R. This implementation utilizes various existing dictionaries, such as Harvard IV, or finance-specific dictionaries. Furthermore, it can also create customized dictionaries. The latter uses LASSO regularization as a statistical approach to select relevant terms based on an exogenous response variable.

name: r-sentimentanalysis
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.3-5" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-sentimentanalysis
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/SentimentAnalysis_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/SentimentAnalysis/SentimentAnalysis_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: fc33262a73365c66c3ff0b693d4faecce03af7c1ad1da4faa606e91362fd96a0

build:
  number: 2
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-glmnet
    - r-moments
    - r-ngramrr >=0.1
    - r-qdapdictionaries
    - r-spikeslab >=1.1
    - r-stringdist
    - r-tm >=0.6
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-glmnet
    - r-moments
    - r-ngramrr >=0.1
    - r-qdapdictionaries
    - r-spikeslab >=1.1
    - r-stringdist
    - r-tm >=0.6

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('SentimentAnalysis')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('SentimentAnalysis')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/sfeuerriegel/SentimentAnalysis
  license: MIT
  summary: Performs a sentiment analysis of textual contents in R. This implementation utilizes various existing dictionaries, such as Harvard IV, or finance-specific dictionaries. Furthermore, it can also create customized dictionaries. The latter uses LASSO regularization as a statistical approach to select relevant terms
    based on an exogenous response variable.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
